Article Title: 'MS Dhoni can't bat 10 overs running full stick'
Article Text:
File image of MS Dhoni (ANI Photo)

GUWAHATI: Chennai Super Kings ( CSK ) are facing a tricky situation regarding MS Dhoni ’s batting position. Having drawn a lot of criticism for coming in to bat at No. 9 against Royal Challengers Bengaluru last week, Dhoni came in to bat at No.7 on Sunday against Rajasthan Royals.His team needed 54 off 25 balls at that point, but Dhoni couldn’t take this team over the line. When he departed after scoring 16 off 11 balls (1x4, 1x6) — Shimron Hetmyer taking a superb catch at deep mid-wicket — CSK still needed 19 off the last five legal deliveries from Sandeep Sharma. They failed to go the distance and lost by six runs.Asked to explain Dhoni’s flickering appearances with the bat and his changing batting positions, CSK head coach Stephen Fleming said, “It’s a time thing. It’s MS who judges it. His body, his knees aren’t what they used to be. He’s moving okay but there’s still an attrition aspect to it. He can’t bat 10 overs running full stick. So, he will gauge on the day what he can give us.“If the game is in the balance, he’ll go a little bit earlier and he backs other players when opportunities are up. So he’s balancing that. I said it last year, he is too valuable to us for leadership and wicketkeeping. To throw him in at 9, 10 overs... he’s actually never done that. So, from around 13, 14 overs he’s looking to go depending on the situation,” the former New Zealand captain said.Analysing their second straight loss this season after the opening win against Mumbai Indians, Fleming said, “It’s probably the two Powerplays. Our Powerplay with the ball went for best part of 80 runs and we were only able to manage mid-40s or early-40s. That’s the big difference."We were also sloppy in the field compared to Rajasthan, who were outstanding. The start of a new three-year cycle (following a mega IPL auction) is always a little bit difficult, especially if you’re just short of a little bit of form.”
Article Summary: MS Dhoni came in to bat at No.7 against Rajasthan Royals on Sunday. His team needed 54 off 25 balls at that point, but Dhoni couldn’t take this team over the line. CSK head coach Stephen Fleming said Dhoni’s flickering appearances with the bat and his changing batting positions are a time thing.

Article Title: "Our business is a piece of sh*t": Michael Wilbon criticizes ESPN and Stephen A. Smith’s obsession with Bronny James
Article Text:
Image via Tim Heitman and Allen Berezovsky/ Getty images

Michael Wilbon calls out ESPN’s priorities

ESPN under fire: Channing Frye, Charles Barkley, and Michael Wilbon criticize network’s shallow coverage of NBA

ESPN has come under fire for its relentless focus on Bronny James, and one of its own, veteran journalist Michael Wilbon , isn’t holding back. Wilbon, the longtime co-host of Pardon the Interruption, recently criticized the network for what he sees as an excessive push to make Bronny a daily topic. Speaking in an interview with Outkick, he revealed that ESPN executives attempted to get him and his co-host Tony Kornheiser to frequently discuss Bronny on their show—something they refused to do.During the interview, Michael Wilbon was candid about the pressure from higher-ups at ESPN to cover Bronny James extensively, even at the expense of more deserving basketball stories. He expressed frustration over the way the network prioritizes narratives that generate buzz over meaningful discussions about the game."There were shows that talked about Bronny every day," Wilbon said. "You know what shows I'm talking about. I don't care if my bosses get mad. They would try to get Tony and me to talk about it. No, we were not going to do it."He acknowledged that as a father, he understands why LeBron James is so invested in his son’s career. However, he took issue with ESPN seemingly placing Bronny’s name above legitimate stars in the NBA."They talked about him more than Shai Gilgeous-Alexander ," Wilbon added. "That's pandering. It's all pandering. Let me be clear: our business is a piece of sh*t a lot of days."Wilbon explained that Pardon the Interruption only covered Bronny when it was truly newsworthy—such as when he was drafted by the Lakers and when he played alongside his father on opening night. In contrast, he noted that other ESPN shows, particularly First Take, seemed to include Bronny in daily debates, overshadowing actual basketball discussions. Many fans have also voiced frustration, questioning whether ESPN's obsession with Bronny is truly about basketball or just a ratings ploy.Wilbon is not alone in his criticism. Former NBA player and analyst Channing Frye also recently called out ESPN after Stephen A. Smith falsely claimed that LeBron James did not attend Kobe Bryant ’s memorial. Frye took to social media to demand more accountability from the network."Please don't lie. Please don't make sh*t up. Fact-check yourself," Frye posted. "The beef is not fun when you've run out of things to talk about. Just don't lie to try and win an argument."Meanwhile, NBA Hall of Famer Charles Barkley has been vocal about what he sees as ESPN’s repetitive and shallow coverage. While speaking on Inside the NBA, Barkley mocked ESPN’s fixation on teams like the Lakers and the Warriors, arguing that it dilutes real basketball conversations."Them fools at the other network, which we're going to be working at next year, that's all they talk about," Barkley said. "Y'all just want to talk about the Warriors and the Lakers... Y'all are idiots cause y'all talk about the Lakers and the Warriors all the time."Wilbon’s remarks came at a time when First Take continued its back-and-forth with LeBron James, a feud that has dominated headlines. However, Wilbon emphasized that this issue is bigger than one individual or one show—it’s a reflection of the entire sports media landscape."This isn't about Stephen A. It's the entire industry," Wilbon stated. "That's what I want to remind LeBron. Our business is just sh*t some days. It just is."As voices like Wilbon, Barkley, and Frye call for a shift in the way sports are covered, the future of sports journalism remains uncertain. The industry is at a crossroads, where it must decide whether to prioritize thoughtful, in-depth coverage or continue chasing sensational stories for ratings.Also Read: LeBron James opens up about the real reason behind his feud with Stephen A. Smith: “He’s on a Taylor Swift tour run” With the debate intensifying, it remains unclear whether calls for journalistic integrity will reshape the landscape or if viral content will continue to dominate. Only time will tell if the media will embrace a more balanced approach to covering the game.
Article Summary: Michael Wilbon, co-host of Pardon the Interruption, has criticized ESPN's coverage of Bronny James. Wilbon revealed that ESPN executives tried to get him and his co- host Tony Kornheiser to frequently discuss Bronny on their show. Charles Barkley has also been vocal about what he sees as ESPN’s repetitive and shallow coverage.

One of the fittest cricketers around, the former India captain last missed a match — before the Nagpur ODI — more than three years ago, the Johannesburg Test against South Africa in Jan 2022. Fit and raring to go, the star batter was the first to hit the nets and batted for nearly an hour before leaving the ground first, shouldering his cricket coffin.While England completely skipped Saturday's practice, many India players also skipped the optional session, including last-match hero Shreyas Iyer , vice-captain Shubman Gill , debutant Harshit Rana, comeback man Mohammed Shami, Hardik Pandya and Axar Patel."Virat Kohli is fit to play. He has come for practice and is good to go," batting coach Sitanshu Kotak said during the prematch media interaction.With a fit-again Kohli back in the playing XI, India will face a selection dilemma as they prepare to tick all the boxes ahead of the Champions Trophy and seal the series before going to Ahmedabad.Will Iyer lose his place to Kohli if the team management decides to continue with Yashasvi Jaiswal to keep the left-right opening combination going with captain Rohit Sharma ? Kotak, however, bypassed any queries on who should make way for Kohli on Sunday."I think that's what the head coach and captain can talk about. But yes, definitely a lefty-righty combination is there. But I would say that question is not something which I would like to answer, to be very honest," was Kotak's diplomatic answer.Rohit's form will certainly also be a concern for the side, no matter how the management tries to brush aside any doubts regarding his continuous run of poor form. Rohit, incidentally, got out after scoring only two runs in the first ODI of this series.Rohit coming back into form will certainly be a big boost for the hosts ahead of the ICC event starting on Feb 19. The track looks a belter and could well be the right platform for the ‘Hitman' to get some much-needed runs under his belt.Meanwhile, KL Rahul is likely to get another look-in as the wicketkeeper-batter ahead of Rishabh Pant, who batted for long in the nets. However, left-arm pacer Arshdeep Singh bowled long spells during the practice session and could replace Shami, who might be rested to manage his workload following a long injury layoff.Although dew factor is unlikely to come into play here, batting second will be the preferred choice, as chasing teams have won 12 out of the 19 ODIs played here over the years.

His love for the sport ran deep, boasting a collection of over 40 team shirts and treasuring match days at Selhurst Park with his brothers.The funeral procession made a special stop at Broome's favorite café in Bognor Regis , where friends gathered to pay tribute. Dressed in custom-made T-shirts in his honour, they clapped as he made his final journey, turning the moment into a celebration of his life rather than a sombre goodbye."The family received overwhelming positive feedback from those who attended, many saying the personal touches made the service a true reflection of Paul’s life," Leggo added. "It was a privilege to help fulfil his last wish."At the time of his passing, Broome worked as a care assistant , dedicating his time to supporting adults with learning disabilities.

Article Title: 'Tension toh...': PBKS troll struggling LSG captain Rishabh Pant; post-IPL auction video goes viral

Punjab Kings secured an impressive eight-wicket victory over Lucknow Super Giants , with Prabhsimran Singh's explosive 69 and captain Shreyas Iyer 's unbeaten 52 leading the chase. The win was followed by a cheeky social media post from Punjab Kings, seemingly responding to LSG captain Rishabh Pant 's pre-season comments about the auction.The social media post showed Iyer striking various poses after the win, accompanied by the caption "Tension toh auction me hi khatm ho gayi thi" (Tension ended in the auction).Before the season began, Pant had expressed his thoughts about the auction in an interview with Star Sports: "I only had one tension, that was Punjab (laughs). They had the highest purse. When Shreyas went to Punjab, I felt I could make it to LSG. There was a possibility. Prabhsimran Singh dominated the early proceedings with his 34-ball 69, which included nine fours and three sixes.Shreyas Iyer provided stability at the end with an unbeaten 52 off 30 balls, ensuring a comfortable victory for his team.Lucknow Super Giants had a difficult start, losing three wickets during the powerplay and managing only 39 runs. Arshdeep Singh was particularly effective, taking three wickets for 43 runs, including the crucial dismissal of Mitchell Marsh for a duck in the first over.The LSG innings saw further setbacks with Aiden Markram falling to Lockie Ferguson, and Rishabh Pant managing just two runs before being dismissed by Glenn Maxwell.Nicholas Pooran (44 off 30) and Ayush Badoni (41 off 33) attempted to stabilise the innings for LSG. Abdul Samad's quick 27 off 12 balls helped push the final total to 171.LSG's bowling attack struggled without Mayank Yadav, who is currently sidelined. Their lead spinner Ravi Bishnoi's poor form continued, while Shardul Thakur and Avesh Khan failed to make an impact.Prabhsimran Singh took advantage of the weakened bowling attack, particularly targeting the pace bowlers during his aggressive innings.

Lucknow Super Giants spinner Digvesh Singh has been fined 25 percent of his match fees and received one demerit point for violating the IPL Code of Conduct during Tuesday's match against Punjab Super Kings in Lucknow.The violation occurred when Singh gave a send-off to Punjab Kings batter Priyansh Arya after dismissing him in the third over.The IPL issued a statement late Tuesday addressing the incident: "Digvesh Singh, Bowler, Lucknow Super Giants has been fined 25 per cent of his match fees and has also accumulated One Demerit Point for breaching the IPL Code of Conduct during his team's match against Punjab Kings at the Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium, Lucknow on Tuesday.""Digvesh Singh admitted to the Level 1 offence under Article 2.5 and accepted the Match Referee's sanction. Article Title: IPL 2025: RCB look to roar louder in home comfort against Gujarat Titans

BENGALURU: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB), perennial slow starters and a side that has too often flattered only to fizzle when it matters, have been a revelation in this Indian Premier League (IPL) so far. As beginnings go, theirs has been pristinely new.Under new captain Rajat Patidar, they have begun impeccably, notching up big wins against Kolkata Knight Riders and Chennai Super Kings. They now have a more balanced side with a competent bowling attack — a bugbear in previous years — complementing a confident batting unit.RCB play the first of their home matches against Gujarat Titans at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium on Wednesday and, given how often they have let down fans, it’s hard not to conjure up the fate that befell their women’s team recently. After a sizzling start in the Women’s Premier League, the defending champions led by Smriti Mandhana lost four consecutive matches at home and crashed out in the league phase.Although the men don’t play that many home matches on the trot, they will have to tread carefully at their home ground, a known batting paradise given its small boundaries.One of their biggest assets is the new-ball bowling pair of Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Josh Hazlewood, old warhorses intimately familiar with conditions in Bengaluru. The city holds a special place for Bhuvneshwar, who cut his teeth in T20 international cricket at this venue against Pakistan in 2012.Hazlewood has been immaculate in the two games so far in the 18th edition of the IPL, a luxury that has helped Patidar channel his bowling options around the veteran Australian. Apart from the seasoned pacers, RCB have the option of playing either Yash Dayal (most likely) or Rasikh Salam. RCB’s all-rounders Krunal Pandya, Liam Livingstone and Suyash Sharma for the crux of their spin department.RCB’s batting lies in its top-order led by the red-hot Phil Salt and Virat Kohli, who is still warming up to the league. With in-form skipper Patidar offering stability, Devdutt Padikkal, Jitesh Sharma and Tim David lend depth to the line-up which will be a worry for any opposition.The Titans, on the other hand, have had a mixed start to their campaign. After a heartbreaking 11-run loss to Punjab Kings in the opener, they recovered to outplay Mumbai Indians by 36 runs in Ahmedabad over the weekend.Helmed by the ‘prince’ of Indian cricket, Shubman Gill, the Titans have a potent batting line-up which includes Sai Sudharsan, Gill, Jos Buttler, Shahrukh Khan, Rahul Tewatia and Sherfane Rutherford. If the RCB bowlers are to have an off-day, Titans have enough ammunition to light up the compact stadium.At the Chinnaswamy, RCB will be wary of the Titans’ bowling attack. Mohammed Siraj has spent the better part of his IPL career at the venue before the Bengaluru outfit let go off him before the mega auction. Then, there is the expertise of home boy Prasidh Krishna and the experience of Ishant Sharma to go with the class of Kagiso Rabada. With Rashid Khan and Sai Kishore also in the frame, the Titans have a better spin attack compared to the hosts.
Article Summary: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) have been a revelation in this Indian Premier League (IPL) so far. Under new captain Rajat Patidar, they have begun impeccably, notching up big wins against Kolkata Knight Riders and Chennai Super Kings. RCB play the first of their home matches against Gujarat Titans on Wednesday.

NEW DELHI: Mumbai Indians ’ young left-arm pacer Ashwani Kumar made an unforgettable IPL debut against Kolkata Knight Riders on Sunday, delivering a record-breaking performance at the Wankhede Stadium. Kumar’s sensational 4 for 24 helped MI bundle out KKR for just 116 in 16.2 overs — the lowest total in this IPL season.The 23-year-old from a town called Jhanjeri, near Chandigarh, became the first Indian to take four wickets on an IPL debut, etching his name in the history books. He joins an elite list of bowlers with standout performances on their first IPL outing, including Alzarri Joseph (6/12) and Andrew Tye (5/17).Also See: MI vs KKR Live Ashwani struck with his very first ball in the IPL, dismissing KKR captain Ajinkya Rahane. His spell, complemented by Deepak Chahar’s 2 for 19, dismantled KKR’s batting lineup, with Angkrish Raghuvanshi top-scoring for them with 26 off 16 balls.Reflecting on his debut, an elated Ashwani said, “I felt very good, there was pressure but the team environment helped me to settle down. I didn’t have lunch today, I only ate a banana, there was some pressure so I didn’t feel hungry. The captain, Hardik bhai, told me to bowl it into the wicket and back my skills. Everyone back in my village will be watching me play, and I’m very happy.”With just four senior T20 matches, two Ranji Trophy, and four List A games under his belt before this, Ashwani’s impact on debut signals a bright future ahead for the young pacer and Mumbai Indians.

Article Title: IPL 2025: Punjab Kings' perfect start continues with win over LSG
Article Text:
Punjab Kings' Prabhsimran Singh, left, and captain Shreyas Iyer (Photo: @PunjabKingsIPL on X)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

LUCKNOW: Punjab Kings (PBKS) stunned Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) in the Indian Premier League (IPL) on their home turf here as skipper Shreyas Iyer and Prabhsimran scored brilliant half-centuries to secure an emphatic eight-wicket win with 22 balls to spare for the team coached by Ricky Ponting.The tone was set by the Punjab bowlers early on as they put up a superb show — led by left-arm pacer Arshdeep Singh — to restrict Lucknow Super Giants to 171/7 at the Ekana stadium on Tuesday. It was a sub-par total on the track and though Punjab stuttered early in the chase, losing Priyansh Arya cheaply, Shreyas Iyer joined hands with Prabhsimran to ease the team’s nerves.Punjab scored 62/1 in the six overs of powerplay. Prabhsimran (69 off 34 balls; 9x4, 3x6) played a brilliant knock, getting to his fifty off just 23 balls. Shreyas and Prabhsimran powered their way to an 84-run stand off 44 balls for the second wicket to virtually seal the outcome.Prabhsimran, though, was out to a brilliant catch from Bishnoi at deep mid-wicket, leaving Shreyas to finish things off with a superb, unbeaten 52 (30b; 3x4, 4x6). Nehal Wadhera also played a good knock, a 25-ball 43, to get Punjab their second win in as many matches.Shreyas sent Abdul Samad soaring over deep mid-wicket to bring up both the victory and his half-century.For Lucknow, skipper Rishabh Pant again failed to contribute with the bat, falling for just 2. Punjab seized the initiative early as LSG’s top order collapsed, with Mitchell Marsh, Aiden Markram and skipper Pant departing in quick succession. Pant, in particular, is having a nightmare start to the season, scoring just 17 runs in three matches.Marsh, following two successive half-centuries, departed for a golden duck, undone by some extra bounce from Arshdeep Singh and managing only a leading edge. Markram got going and even had a 31-run partnership off 19 balls with Nicholas Pooran before he fell inside-edging a Lockie Ferguson delivery onto his stumps.Pant’s dismissal was the most disappointing, the LSG skipper falling to a half-tracker from Maxwell. Only Ayush Badoni (41 off 33b, 1x4, 3x6) and Nicholas Pooran (44 off 30) made noteworthy contributions in Lucknow's chase, but it wasn’t enough in the end.The outcome puts Pant and his team under even more pressure, while Punjab will be delighted to have begun the long season on a bright note.“To be honest, there’s no right combination. It’s just that the camaraderie and synergy has to click at the right time. You just need to have a similar kind of mindset,” Shreyas, whose captaincy has been impressive, said.Pant, meanwhile, said, “It was not enough, we were 20-25 runs short. You cannot control each and every thing.”
Article Summary: Punjab Kings (PBKS) stunned Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) in the Indian Premier League (IPL) Shreyas Iyer and Prabhsimran scored brilliant half-centuries to secure an emphatic eight-wicket win with 22 balls to spare.

NEW DELHI: Punjab Kings secured their second consecutive victory in the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025, defeating the Lucknow Super Giants by eight wickets on Tuesday.Captain Shreyas Iyer continued his impressive form, notching his second consecutive half-century and leading Punjab to a comfortable win with 22 balls remaining.Sent to bat first, Lucknow struggled to establish a strong foundation, losing early wickets and reaching a final total of 171/7 in their allotted 20 overs. Article Title: IPL 2025 Points Table Update: Standings after LSG vs PBKS match
Article Text:
Shreyas Iyer (Image credit: BCCI/IPL)

NEW DELHI: Punjab Kings continued their impressive run in IPL 2025 with a dominant eight-wicket victory over Lucknow Super Giants, propelling them to the second spot on the points table. With two wins in as many matches, Punjab now have four points and a strong net run rate of +1.485, only behind Royal Challengers Bengaluru , who lead the standings with a superior NRR of +2.266.The win against LSG was built on a stellar all-round performance. Arshdeep Singh's three-wicket burst restricted Lucknow to 171/7 before Prabhsimran Singh’s explosive 69 off 34 balls made light work of the chase.With captain Shreyas Iyer (52*) and Nehal Wadhera (43*) finishing the job in just 16.2 overs, Punjab strengthened their position as one of the early frontrunners in the tournament.Meanwhile, Lucknow Super Giants are feeling the heat after their second loss in three games.They now sit in sixth place with two points and a negative net run rate of -0.150. Rishabh Pant's side has struggled to find consistency, with their batting woes continuing as the captain himself has failed to fire.Close behind, Punjab Kings and Delhi Capitals have also won both their matches and are level on points with RCB at 4 points each.Punjab Kings, riding on strong performances from Prabhsimran Singh and Arshdeep Singh, hold the second spot with an NRR of +1.485, while Delhi Capitals follow closely at +1.320.Gujarat Titans, with one win and one loss in two matches, are sitting at fourth place with 2 points and an NRR of +0.625.Among teams that have played three matches, Mumbai Indians , Lucknow Super Giants, Chennai Super Kings, Sunrisers Hyderabad, Rajasthan Royals, and Kolkata Knight Riders all have just one win each and are separated only by Net Run Rate.Mumbai Indians are slightly ahead with +0.309, while Lucknow Super Giants (-0.150), CSK (-0.771), and Sunrisers (-0.871) follow.At the bottom of the table, Rajasthan Royals (-1.112) and Kolkata Knight Riders (-1.428) are struggling with poor NRRs despite having one win each.
Article Summary: Punjab Kings beat Lucknow Super Giants by eight wickets in IPL 2025. Punjab now have four points and a strong net run rate of +1.485. Royal Challengers Bengaluru lead the standings with a superior NRR of +2.266.

The iconic ‘ notebook celebration ’ is once again in the spotlight. Made famous by Virat Kohli , the celebration has resurfaced in IPL 2025 , this time courtesy of Lucknow Super Giants ’ leg-spinner Digvesh Rathi .During LSG’s clash against Punjab Kings , Rathi pulled out the old-school ‘notebook celebration’ after dismissing Punjab opener Priyansh Arya in a high-stakes run chase.Arya, who gained fame for hitting six sixes in the Delhi Premier League, was walking back to the pavilion when Rathi mimicked the famous gesture—holding out his left hand like a page and pretending to jot down a dismissal.The move echoed the 2017 exchange between Kesrick Williams and Virat Kohli, which Kohli famously responded to during a T20I in Hyderabad in 2019.Earlier, Lucknow Super Giants posted 171/7 in 20 overs, with Nicholas Pooran scoring a crucial 44 and Ayush Badoni adding 41.Arshdeep Singh was the standout bowler for Punjab, finishing with figures of 3/43.In response, Punjab Kings put on a dominant batting display, chasing down the target in just 16.2 overs.Prabhsimran Singh led the charge with a blistering 69 off 34 balls, while Shreyas Iyer remained unbeaten on 52 alongside Nehal Wadhera, who contributed 43*.Punjab Kings will now face Rajasthan Royals at the Maharaja Yadavindra Singh International Cricket Stadium in Mullanpur, Chandigarh, on Saturday.
Article Summary: Leg-spinner Digvesh Rathi mimics Virat Kohli's 'notebook celebration' after dismissing Punjab opener Priyansh Arya. Rathi holds out his left hand like a page and pretending to jot down a dismissal. Lucknow Super Giants posted 171/7 in 20 overs, with Nicholas Pooran scoring 44.
